甛字的基本解释

甛
tián
古同“甜”。

甛字的汉语字典释义

[①]［tián］
［《廣韻》徒兼切，平添，定。］
亦作“甛1”。亦作“餂2”。
(1)像糖或蜜的味道。
(2)比喻幸福；快乐。
(3)美好。
(4)形容睡得酣畅。
(5)指美言。
(6)指浓郁软熟的画风。
(7)谓投其所好而使之入迷。

甛字的康熙字典解释

【午集上】【甘字部】　甛； 康熙笔画：11； 页码：页754第11
〔古文〕餂【唐韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?徒兼切，音恬。【說文】美也。从舌作甛。舌知甘者。【博雅】甛，甘也。【張衡·南都賦】酸甜滋味，百種千名。　又【蘇軾·發廣州詩】三杯輭飽後，一枕黑甜餘。【註】輭飽謂飮酒，黑甜謂臥睡也。　又水名。【洞冥記】甜水去虞淵八十里。　【集韻】亦書作甜。

甛字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体韩国明朝体
甛字的起名意思

暂无。

甛
Basic explanation of words
甛
tián
Gu Tong is "sweet".
甛
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［tián］
["Guangyun" is both apprentice and cut, flattened, fixed. ]
Also known as "甛1". Also known as "餂2".
(1) Taste like sugar or honey.
(2) Metaphor of happiness; happiness.
(3) Beautiful.
(4) Describe a sound sleep.
(5) Refers to beautiful words.
(6) Refers to the strong and soft style of painting.
(7) It is said to be fascinated by it.
甛
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Won Collection 1] [Gan Zi Department] 　甛; Kangxi strokes: 11; Page number: page 754 to 11
〔古文〕餂【Tang Yun】【Ji Yun】【Rhyme Meeting】【Zheng Yun】? Disciple and cut, Yin Tian. [Said Wen] Mei Ye. From the tongue. Those who know the tongue willingly. [Bo Ya] Wu, Gan Ye. 【Zhang Heng·Nandu Fu】Sweet and sour taste, hundreds of thousands of names.　[Su Shi·Send Guangzhou Poetry] After three cups of fullness, I sleep in black and sweet. 【Note】Satisfaction means glutinous wine, black sweet means lying down.　Also known as water. [Dong Ming Ji] Sweet water goes to Yu Yuan for eighty miles.　【Jiyun】It is also a sweet book.
